item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "True wisdom gives the only possible answer at any given moment, and that night, going back to bed was the only possible answer." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You are, after all, what you think. Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "There is a reason they call God a presence - because God is right here, right now. In the present is the only place to find Him, and now is the only time." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "This is what rituals are for. We do spiritual ceremonies as human beings in order to create a safe resting place for our most complicated feelings of joy or trauma, so that we don't have to haul those feelings around with us forever, weighing us down. We all need such places of ritual safekeeping. And I do believe that if your culture or tradition doesn't have the specific ritual you are craving, then you are absolutely permitted to make up a ceremony of your own devising, fixing your own broken-down emotional systems with all the do-it-yourself resourcefulness of a generous plumber/poet." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "God dwells within you, as you." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "The Yogic scriptures say that God responds to the sacred prayers and efforts of human beings in any way whatsoever that mortals choose to worship - just so long as those prayers are sincere." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Imagine that the universe is a great spinning engine. You want to stay near the core of the thing - right in the hub of the wheel - not out at the edges where all the wild whirling takes place, where you can get frayed and crazy. The hub of calmness - that's your heart. That's where God lives within you. So stop looking for answers in the world. Just keep coming back to that center and you'll always find peace." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "Home is the nicest word there is." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Amber add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Amber add a quote by Thomas Moore
item.description: "The ordinary acts we practice every day at home are of more importance to the soul than their simplicity might suggest." -- Thomas Moore

item.title: Amber add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "There were two things about Mama. One is she always expected the best out of me. And the other is that then no matter what I did, whatever I came home with, she acted like it was the moon I had just hung up in the sky and plugged in all the stars. Like I was that good." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Amber add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Amber add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amber add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches." -- Lemony Snicket
